00080 char code node_name[] = "SCS-600";

00082 /* declare number of sub-addresses to framework */
00083 unsigned char idata _n_sub_addr = 1;
00084 
00085 #undef SINGLE_SHOT               /* #define/#undef for single shot capability */
00086 
00087 sbit SR_CLOCK  = P0 ^ 4;         // Shift register clock
00088 sbit SR_STROBE = P0 ^ 5;         // Storage register clock
00089 sbit SR_DATAO  = P0 ^ 6;         // Serial data out
00090 sbit SR_DATAI  = P0 ^ 7;         // Serial data in
00091 sbit SR_OE     = P0 ^ 3;         // Output enable
00092 sbit SR_READB  = P0 ^ 2;         // Serial data readback
00093 
00094 /*---- Define variable parameters returned to CMD_GET_INFO command ----*/
00095 
00096 /* data buffer (mirrored in EEPROM) */
00097 
00098 struct {
00099    unsigned char out[8];
00100    unsigned char button;
00101    unsigned char p1;
00102 #ifdef SINGLE_SHOT
00103    unsigned char single;
00104 #endif
00105    unsigned char input[2];
00106    float power[8];
00107 } idata user_data;

00110    1, UNIT_BOOLEAN, 0, 0, 0, "Out0", &user_data.out[0],

00138 /********************************************************************\

00146 void user_write(unsigned char channel) reentrant;

00149 /*---- User init function ------------------------------------------*/
00150 
00151 void user_init(unsigned char init)
00152 {
00153    unsigned char i;
00154 
00155    PRT0CF = 0x7B;               // push-pull for P0.0,1,3,4,5,6
00156    PRT1CF = 0xFF;               // push-pull for P1
00157 
00158    /* init shift register lines */
00159    SR_OE = 1;
00160    SR_CLOCK = 0;
00161    SR_DATAO = 0;
00162    SR_DATAI = 1;                // prepare for input
00163 
00164    /* initialize configuration data */
00165    if (init) {
00166       for (i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00167          user_data.out[i] = 0;
00168          user_data.p1 = 0;
00169          user_data.power[i] = 100;
00170       }
00171    }
00172 
00173    /* set outputs according to main switch */
00174    for (i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00175       if (user_data.out[i])
00176          output |= (1 << i);
00177       else
00178          output &= ~(1 << i);
00179    }
00180 
00181    /* output P1 value from EEPROM */
00182    user_write(9);
00183 
00184    /* output initial values */
00185    ser_clock();
00186 }
00187 
00188 
00189 /*---- User write function -----------------------------------------*/
00190 
00191 void user_write(unsigned char index) reentrant
00192 {
00193    if (index == 9)
00194       P1 = user_data.p1;
00195 }
00196 
00197 /*---- User read function ------------------------------------------*/
00198 
00199 unsigned char user_read(unsigned char index)
00200 {
00201    if (index);
00202    return 0;
00203 }
00204 
00205 /*---- User function called vid CMD_USER command -------------------*/
00206 
00207 unsigned char user_func(unsigned char *data_in, unsigned char *data_out)
00208 {
00209    /* echo input data */
00210    data_out[0] = data_in[0];
00211    data_out[1] = data_in[1];
00212    return 2;
00213 }
00214 
00215 /*---- Clock external shift registers to read and output data ------*/
00216 
00217 void ser_clock()
00218 {
00219    unsigned char d, i;
00220 
00221    /* first shift register (buttons) */
00222    for (i = d = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00223       if (SR_DATAI)
00224          d |= (0x80 >> i);
00225 
00226       delay_us(10);
00227       SR_CLOCK = 1;
00228       delay_us(10);
00229       SR_CLOCK = 0;
00230       delay_us(10);
00231    }
00232 
00233    user_data.button = d;
00234 
00235    /* second shift register (LED & input2) */
00236    for (i = d = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00237       if (SR_DATAI)
00238          d |= (0x01 << i);
00239 
00240       SR_DATAO = ((output & (0x01 << i)) == 0);
00241       delay_us(10);
00242       SR_CLOCK = 1;
00243       delay_us(10);
00244       SR_CLOCK = 0;
00245       delay_us(10);
00246    }
00247 
00248    user_data.input[1] = d;
00249 
00250    /* third shift register (VR & input1) */
00251    for (i = d = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00252       if (SR_DATAI)
00253          d |= (0x01 << i);
00254 
00255       SR_DATAO = ((output & (0x80 >> i)) == 0);
00256       delay_us(10);
00257       SR_CLOCK = 1;
00258       delay_us(10);
00259       SR_CLOCK = 0;
00260       delay_us(10);
00261    }
00262 
00263    user_data.input[0] = d;
00264 
00265    /* strobe for output and next input */
00266    SR_STROBE = 1;
00267    delay_us(10);
00268    SR_STROBE = 0;
00269 
00270    /* after first cycle, enable outputs */
00271    SR_OE = 0;
00272 }
00273 
00274 /*---- Apply power settings as a fraction of a second --------------*/
00275 
00276 unsigned char cycle;
00277 unsigned char ca[8];
00278 
00279 void set_power(void)
00280 {
00281    unsigned char i;
00282    static unsigned long on_time;
00283    float frac;
00284    unsigned long expired;
00285 
00286    /* turn output off after on-time expired */
00287    for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00288       if (user_data.power[i] < 100) {
00289          expired = time() - on_time;
00290          if (expired >= (unsigned long) (user_data.power[i])) {
00291 
00292 #ifdef SINGLE_SHOT
00293             /* check for single shot */
00294             if ((user_data.single & (1 << i)) && (output & (1 << i))) {
00295                output &= ~(1 << i);
00296                user_data.out[i] = 0;
00297             } else
00298 #endif
00299             {
00300 
00301                frac = user_data.power[i] - (unsigned long) (user_data.power[i]);
00302 
00303                if (frac == 0 || expired >= (unsigned long) (user_data.power[i]) + 1) {
00304                   output &= ~(1 << i);
00305                } else if (cycle > 0) {
00306                   if ((float) ca[i] / cycle > frac)
00307                      output &= ~(1 << i);
00308                   else
00309                      ca[i]++;
00310                } else {
00311                   ca[i]++;
00312                }
00313             }
00314          }
00315       }
00316 
00317    /* turn all outputs on every second */
00318    if (time() - on_time >= 100) {
00319       on_time = time();
00320       for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00321          if (user_data.power[i] > 0 && user_data.out[i])
00322             output |= (1 << i);
00323 
00324       cycle = (cycle + 1) % 10;
00325 
00326       if (cycle == 0)
00327          for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00328             ca[i] = 0;
00329    }
00330 
00331    /* turn output off according to main switch */
00332    for (i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00333       if (!user_data.out[i])
00334          output &= ~(1 << i);
00335    }
00336 
00337    /* set outputs according to main switch */
00338    for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00339       if (user_data.power[i] >= 100) {
00340          if (user_data.out[i])
00341             output |= (1 << i);
00342          else
00343             output &= ~(1 << i);
00344       }
00345 }
00346 
00347 /*---- User loop function ------------------------------------------*/
00348 
00349 void user_loop(void)
00350 {
00351    unsigned char i, old_button;
00352 /*
00353 static unsigned long last = 300;
00354 static bit first = 1;
00355 */
00356 
00357    /* read inputs */
00358    old_button = user_data.button;
00359    ser_clock();
00360    for (i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00361       if ((user_data.button & (1 << i)) > 0 && (old_button & (1 << i)) == 0)
00362          user_data.out[i] = !user_data.out[i];
00363    }
00364 
00365    /* set output according to power */
00366    set_power();
00367 
00368    /*
00369       if (!DEBUG_MODE && time() > last+30)
00370       {
00371       if (first)
00372       {
00373       lcd_clear();
00374       first = 0;
00375       }
00376 
00377       last = time();
00378 
00379       lcd_goto(0, 0);
00380       printf("OUT: ");
00381       for (i=0 ; i<8 ; i++)
00382       printf("%c", user_data.out[i] ? '1' : '0');
00383 
00384       lcd_goto(0, 1);
00385       printf("IN:  ");
00386       for (i=0 ; i<8 ; i++)
00387       printf("%c", user_data.button & (1<<i) ? '1' : '0');
00388       }
00389     */
00390 }
